title: Textile, "Felt Lace X-Change", 2008
medium:
Medium: merino wool
Technique: two intercrossed plain weave structures (double cloth), fulled and hand-cut
creditline: Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund
description: Off-white wool is woven in double-cloth to form four tubes, all with an open weave structure. The fabric is fulled to give a felted appearance, and some of the tubes are hand-cut to create a series of intersecting panels.
